subject: Re: [junit] Mock framework reviews
msgSnippet: I´m using Easy Mock, but I think I´m using less than the framework can offer to me... I´m just using to return values. Does anyone here has used it for
messageBody:
I´m using Easy Mock, but I think I´m using less than the framework can offer
to me...

I´m just using to return values. Does anyone here has used it for something
else?

myMock.getSomething();
mockControl.setReturnValue("Something", 1);

mockControle.replay();

On 5/2/07, James Abley <james.abley@...> wrote:
>
> Hi all,
>
> I'm looking to use a Mock framework. I was using a home-grown one with
> a previous employer, but that isn't (yet - I'm hopeful!) open-sourced
> / externally available, so I need to make a jump to another one.
>
> I tried EasyMock (1.x) after reading JB's book a couple of years back
> - I think the state of the art has moved on somewhat since then.
>
> The closed framework that I used previously seems pretty similar in
> terms of look and feel to rMock 2.0 and JMock 2.0, but I'm open to
> other suggestions.
>
> What experiences to people have to share?
>
> Cheers,
>
> James
>
>
